summary: An internal FBI email from July 3, 2019, discussing operational planning following the indictment of Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York. It details the need for agents to be on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview individuals.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant; believed to be in France at the time of the email.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking FBI New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting agent availability for the Epstein investigation and arrest operation.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and a warrant for his arrest was sworn out.

events.title: FBI Operational Planning Email
events.description: An FBI email coordinates standby plans to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida.
personsInvolved: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking FBI New York

locations: NYC (New York City, presumably Epstein's residence)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on or before July 2, 2019.
An arrest warrant for Epstein was active, and the FBI planned to take him into custody immediately upon his return to the United States.
At the time of the email (July 3, 2019), Epstein was believed to be in France.
The FBI's operational plan included executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence and interviewing co-conspirators.
The plan also involved immediately deploying two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview 1-3 individuals.
